ben.ladalja

Class DB

  • java.lang.Object
    • ben.ladalja.DB

  • public final class DB
extends java.lang.Object
    Ladalja makes interacting with databases extremely simple across a variety of database backends using either raw SQL, the fluent query builder, and the model.
    DB is which one you will need if you do not use models
    Thus is you want to write raw SQL or using QueryBuilder.

    Before do any thing you will need to indicate where Ladalja config file is located, and in that file your config must look like:

    DB_DRIVER= driver_for_JDBC
    DB_CONNECTION=database_connection_type
    DB_HOST=host_where_is_located_database
    DB_PORT=port
    DB_DATABASE=database_name
    DB_USERNAME=user_name_for_database
    DB_PASSWORD=password_for_above_user_name

    All those properties must be present to indicated, use the static public field of DB class named CONFIG_FILE_URL like
    DB.CONFIG_FILE_URL = "url_to_config_file"

    after that you can use DB for anythings, for example if you want a raw select SQL query do like DB.select("select * from users"); and it will return you a java.sql.ResultSet containing your query result. There is method for any type of Query select,insert,update and SQL like ALTER TABLE for this last use statement(String) method In all request, the transaction process is implemented, but you can if you want do it by yourself using beginTransaction() , commit() and rollBack() methods

    If you want to start request using QueryBuilder, you just have to use table(String) method where the String parameter is the name of the table on which request will proceed, a new instance of QueryBuilder will be returned.

    The is also something to listen each query Ladalja make through register(ben.ladalja.QueryListener) .

    Author:
    MEZATSONG TSAFACK Carrel, meztsacar@gmail.com

      • connection

        public static java.sql.Connection connection()
                                      throws ben.ladalja.LadaljaException
        Provide the connection object to database, using the configuration file properties
        Returns:
        a java.sql.Connection instance which is used for querying, new instance will be loaded only the first time you call it or at the first querying
        Throws:
        ben.ladalja.LadaljaException - if there is error in configuration file while loading

        Parameters:
        query - the query, eventually with parameters
        params - list of query parameters
        Returns:
        ResultSet the result of query
        Throws:
        ben.ladalja.LadaljaException - if query is not SELECT type

        Returns:
        ID of new inserted row
        Throws:
        ben.ladalja.LadaljaException - if query is not SELECT type or id column doesn't exist
